description:
President Juan Orlando Hernández of Honduras announced that the first doses of the covid vaccine will arrive in the second half of February.
It could be between 400,000 and 800,000 doses that will come in the first delivery through the Covax Mechanism, of the World Health Organization (WHO); These vaccines are part of the donation that will be made to immunize 20% of the population (1.9 million Hondurans). On national television, the president recalled that in addition to the donated vaccines, he has already secured himself with contributions from the State and the affiliates of the Honduran Institute of Social Security (IHSS) the vaccine for their beneficiaries, which would be arriving in the country as of April 21. The vaccine that will arrive in the country will be from the pharmaceutical company Astrazeneca and the University of Oxford, which has between a 62% and 90% effective and is being applied in several countries, announced the Deputy Minister of Health, Nery Cerrato.

description: On March 13, 2021, The first COVID-19 vaccine doses arrived in Honduras through the COVAX mechanism, a global effort between the Coalition for Promotion of Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI), the Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunization (GAVI), the World Health Organization (WHO) with collaboration of the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) and the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), to ensure equitable distribution of vaccines worldwide. Frontline workers have begun to receive government-sponsored vaccines secured by the Covax-Gavi agreement.  The vaccine is from the pharmaceutical company Astrazeneca and the University of Oxford. Nationwide vaccination will be implemented in different phases, starting with frontline staff. The vaccination target population is estimated at 5,717,985 Hondurans, distributed by prioritized groups.

On April 16, Honduras received the first 6,000 doses of the Russian Sputnik V vaccine, as part of the contract established between the Central American country and Russia for 4.2 million of the preparation against the coronavirus, an official source reported.
The first batch of the Sputnik V vaccine arrived at the Ramón Villeda Morales International Airport, in northern Honduras, on a plane from Moscow, the Honduran Presidency said.
The head of the Honduran Expanded Immunization Program, Berenice Molina, told reporters that the vaccine will be applied first to health personnel, then to adults over 60 years of age and later to people with some morbidity.

Unlike in other parts of the country, no one is allowed to leave their house for buying food or medicine. Just home delivery is allowed for supermarkets, grocery shops and pharmacies. Delivery is allowed for small shops ("pulperías") between 7AM and 8PM and for supermarkets and pharmacies from 7AM to 5PM. The transport, agriculture, and health sectors are allowed to run normally (with enforced hygiene measures), all other businesses are not allowed to open. Entrance roads to the named provinces/municipalities are controlled.
